chapters.title: Academic Word List 1
chapters.content:
This list contains important words frequently used in academic texts. Understanding them is crucial for success in higher education.

1. aberrant

English Definition: markedly different from an accepted norm

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: স্বাভাবিক বা সাধারণ নিয়ম থেকে বিচ্যুত; অস্বাভাবিক।

Examples:

  • If my aunt does not take her medication, she will have aberrant mood swings.
  • The drunken man’s aberrant conduct drew the police officer’s attention.

2. aesthetic

English Definition: characterized by an appreciation of beauty or good taste

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সৌন্দর্য বা রুচির প্রতি অনুরাগ; নান্দনিক।

Examples:

  • The committee did not attempt to make aesthetic judgements.
  • Maybe it was time they started paying more attention to the aesthetic value of things.

3. aggregate

English Definition: a sum total of many heterogeneous things taken together

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: বিভিন্ন জিনিসের সমষ্টি; মোট।

Examples:

  • The producers will aggregate singers into groups based on gender and age.
  • The fire drill shows our ability to aggregate in preselected destinations.

4. amalgamate

English Definition: bring or combine together or with something else

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: একত্রিত করা; মিশিয়ে দেওয়া।

Examples:

  • The two companies will amalgamate in a mutually beneficial merger next week.
  • Because of budget cuts, the two schools were forced to amalgamate into one building.

5. ambiguous

English Definition: having more than one possible meaning

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: যার একাধিক অর্থ হতে পারে; দ্ব্যর্থক।

Examples:

  • Instead of being ambiguous with your words, be clearer and more specific.
  • With an ambiguous plot, no one could understand the film's premise.

6. ambivalence

English Definition: mixed feelings or emotions

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: মিশ্র অনুভূতি বা আবেগ; উভয়সংকট।

Examples:

  • Tad felt a great deal of ambivalence about accepting the new position.
  • Many people show ambivalence towards technology.

7. analogous

English Definition: similar or equivalent in some respects

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু ক্ষেত্রে অনুরূপ বা সমতুল্য; সাদৃশ্যপূর্ণ।

Examples:

  • All of the actors reading for the role were analogous to each other in appearance.
  • We couldn’t decide between the two tiles because they were analogous to one another.

8. anomalous

English Definition: deviating from the general or common order or type

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সাধারণ বা সাধারণ নিয়ম বা ধরণ থেকে বিচ্যুত; ব্যতিক্রমী।

Examples:

  • He is in an anomalous position as the only part-time worker in the firm.
  • In fact, the anomalous status gave him greater leeway.

9. antipathy

English Definition: a feeling of intense dislike

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: তীব্র অপছন্দ বা ঘৃণা; বিদ্বেষ।

Examples:

  • After serving in the war, he developed an antipathy to guns.
  • After hearing about public antipathy to his programs, the candidate hired a new consultant.

10. apprise

English Definition: inform somebody of something

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কাউকে কোনো কিছু সম্পর্কে অবহিত করা; জানানো।

Examples:

  • The scouts went back to apprise their commanding officer of the enemy’s location.
  • Each week, the teachers apprise parents of their students’ progress.

11. approbation

English Definition: official acceptance or agreement

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: আনুষ্ঠানিক স্বীকৃতি বা সম্মতি; অনুমোদন।

Examples:

  • I need to write a powerful resume to gain approbation from an employer.
  • You cannot take prescription medication without a doctor's approbation.

12. appropriate

English Definition: suitable for a particular person, place, or situation

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো নির্দিষ্ট ব্যক্তি, স্থান বা পরিস্থিতির জন্য উপযুক্ত।

Examples:

  • The appropriate response to a gift is to thank the giver.
  • Her speech was appropriate for the audience.

13. artless

English Definition: simple and natural; without cunning or deceit

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সরল এবং স্বাভাবিক; চালাকি বা প্রতারণা ছাড়া।

Examples:

  • My artless comment was mistaken for rudeness.
  • The child asked many artless questions.

14. audacious

English Definition: disposed to venture or take risks

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ঝুঁকি নিতে বা সাহস করে কিছু করতে ইচ্ছুক; দুঃসাহসী।

Examples:

  • Your plan of going abroad is an audacious decision.
  • He described the plan as ambitious and audacious.

15. autonomous

English Definition: existing as an independent entity

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: স্বাধীন সত্তা হিসেবে বিদ্যমান; স্বায়ত্তশাসিত।

Examples:

  • Teachers aim to help children become autonomous learners.
  • His philosophy is about becoming an autonomous individual.

16. aver

English Definition: declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: গম্ভীরভাবে এবং আনুষ্ঠানিকভাবে সত্য বলে ঘোষণা করা; নিশ্চিত করা।

Examples:

  • I aver that I have spoken the truth.
  • I still aver that his report is true.

17. banal

English Definition: repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অতিরিক্ত বার বার ব্যবহৃত; অতি পরিচিত হওয়ার কারণে মূল্যহীন; গতানুগতিক।

Examples:

  • It was just another banal newspaper story.
  • Melissa murmured some banal phrases of encouragement.

18. beneficent

English Definition: doing or producing good

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ভালো কিছু করা বা উৎপাদন করা; উপকারী।

Examples:

  • Many beneficent projects have to be foregone if sufficient funds are lacking.
  • The farm was under the care of a beneficent power.

19. bombastic

English Definition: ostentatiously lofty in style

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: জাঁকজমকপূর্ণ বা জমকালো শৈলীতে; বাগাড়ম্বরপূর্ণ।

Examples:

  • He is best known for three rather bombastic poems.
  • The candidate spoke in a bombastic way of all that he would do if elected.

20. boorish

English Definition: ill-mannered and coarse in behavior or appearance

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অভদ্র এবং আচরণ বা চেহারায় অমার্জিত; রূঢ়।

Examples:

  • I found him rather boorish and aggressive.
  • He disgusted many with his boorish behaviour.

chapters.title: Compare & Contrast Paragraph
chapters.content:
Definition: A comparison paragraph explains the similarities in two subjects. A contrast paragraph explains the differences in two subjects.

Purpose: To show how subjects are alike or different.

Methods for Organizing

Point-by-Point Method

This method alternates between the two subjects, discussing one point at a time for each.

  • Point 1 - discuss Subject A
  • Point 1 - discuss Subject B
  • Point 2 - discuss Subject A
  • Point 2 - discuss Subject B

Block / Subject-by-Subject Method

This method presents all arguments related to Subject A first, and then presents all the arguments for Subject B.

  • Subject A - Point 1, Point 2, Point 3
  • Subject B - Point 1, Point 2, Point 3

Useful Transitional Devices

For Comparison: similar to, similarly, in the same way, like, equally, also, too, each of

For Contrast: in contrast, on the other hand, different from, whereas, while, unlike, however, but

Example: Basketball and Soccer

Basketball and soccer are sports with many similarities and differences. Both sports are fun to play and are played with a round ball. Similarly, they both provide a ton of cardiovascular exercise. However, the differences are also clear. A basketball player uses his hands, whereas a soccer player uses his feet. In contrast to basketball which is played indoors, soccer is usually played outside on a large field.

Exercise 1

Write a compare and/or contrast paragraph between city life and urban life.

This exercise requires students to write their own paragraphs. A sample answer could compare location (city is crowded, urban is less so), job opportunities (more in the city), and lifestyle (faster-paced in the city, quieter in urban/suburban areas).

chapters.title: Argumentative Paragraph
chapters.content:
Definition: An argument is an opinion (a claim) supported by facts (evidence).

Purpose: To present a position and to have an audience adopt or at least seriously consider your argument.

Outline

  • Topic Sentence: Identify what is being argued for or against (your claim).
  • Support Sentences: Include evidence like facts, examples, statistics, and expert research. You can also include a counter-argument to show you've considered other views.
  • Concluding Sentence: Restate what is being argued for and why.

Useful Transitional Words

For giving reasons: because, since, for, due to the fact that

For counter-argument: but, however, of course, nevertheless, although, despite

For concluding: therefore, as a result, in conclusion, thus, consequently

Example: Technology makes us antisocial

I agree with the statement that technology can make us antisocial. We are leading a luxurious lifestyle with the help of technology, but many things come with a price. For example, as smart phones have given us effortless life, it has affected us physically and socially. Kids spend time on phone playing games or watching videos. Consequently, they do not go for outings or any physical activities. To conclude, I would like to state that technology should be used as an aid to give comfort, but not as an alternative for real life socialization.

chapters.title: Process Analysis Paragraph
chapters.content:
Definition: A process paragraph uses details and examples to explain how to do something or how a thing works.

Purpose: To explain to the reader the order or steps needed to do something or to make something work.

Types of Process Analysis

  1. Informative: Explains how something works (e.g., how a car engine functions). Usually written in the third person.
  2. Directive: Explains how to do something (e.g., how to change a tire). Usually written in the second person ("you").

In both forms, the steps are typically organized in chronological order.

Useful Transitional Devices

At the start: At first, In the beginning, The first step...

In the middle: Next, After that, Continuing with, Then...

At the end: Finally, As you finish, The last step...

Example: Steps to Success (Job Interview)

There are several steps that are necessary to prepare for a job interview. First of all, it is important to double check the time and location of the interview. Secondly, pick clothing that is appropriate for the type of job. Thirdly, before the interview, it is a good idea to do some research about the company. Finally, the applicant should end the interview positively with a handshake and enthusiasm about the job. By following these steps, applicants can increase their chances of hearing those exciting words, “You’re hired.”

chapters.title: Cover Letter & CV
chapters.content:
What is a Cover Letter?

A cover letter is a document sent with your resume to provide additional information on your skills and experience. It provides detailed information on why you are qualified for the job you are applying for. Employers use cover letters as a way to screen applicants and to determine which candidates they would like to interview.

What is a Curriculum Vitae (CV)?

The curriculum vitae, also known as a CV or vita, is a comprehensive statement of your educational background, teaching, and research experience. It is the standard representation of credentials within academia.

Cover Letter Example Snippet

Sub: Applying for the post of a Librarian

Dear Sir,

I, Faria Islam, would like to apply for the position of a Librarian which was advertised in The New Age dated on 10 December, 2018.

I am enthusiastically applying for this position because I firmly believe that a combination of my natural ability, personality and work experience all make me an ideal candidate for this role. In my current position as a Librarian Intern with British Council Library, I have gained an insight into the different levels of library management.

CV Example Snippet

Professional Summary:

Enthusiastic, effective, passionate to take any kind of challenge. Assistant Head of Department with a proven record of helping children progress, providing positive learning experiences as well as building and maintaining effective behavior management systems. Enjoys sharing knowledge, inspiring both children and adults.

Work Experience:

11/2016 – Present
Assistant Head of Department, Little Scholars’ School

chapters.title: Formal Letter Format
chapters.content:
A formal letter is any letter written for a formal purpose, whether that be a recommendation letter, an invitation letter, or a complaint letter. Any communication that is considered official enough to be explicitly written or typed is a formal letter.

Parts of a Formal Letter

Business letters usually contain the following information in this order:

  1. Letterhead or sender's address
  2. Date
  3. Inside address (recipient's address)
  4. Salutation (e.g., "Dear Mr. Chowdhury:")
  5. Message/Body
  6. Closing (e.g., "Yours sincerely," or "Yours faithfully,")
  7. Signature

Key Formatting Points

  • Use "Yours faithfully" when you do not know the recipient's name (e.g., "Dear Sir or Madam").
  • Use "Yours sincerely" when you know the recipient's name (e.g., "Dear Ms. Chowdhury").
  • The recipient's name in the salutation is followed by a colon (:).
  • The first paragraph should state the purpose of the letter. The last paragraph should state what action you expect the recipient to take.

chapters.title: Run-ons
chapters.content:
These are also called fused sentences. You are making a run-on when you put two complete sentences (a subject and its predicate and another subject and its predicate) together in one sentence without separating them properly.

Example of a run-on:

My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus it is very garlicky.

This one sentence actually contains two complete sentences. Luckily, there are many ways to correct this.

How to Correct a Run-on Sentence

  1. Use a semicolon:
    My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus; it is very garlicky.
  2. Use a comma and a coordinating conjunction (for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so):
    My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus, for it is very garlicky.
  3. Use a subordinating conjunction:
    My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus because it is very garlicky.
  4. Make it into two separate sentences:
    My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus. It is very garlicky.
  5. Use an em-dash (a long dash) for emphasis:
    My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus—it is very garlicky.

REMEMBER: You CANNOT simply add a comma between the two sentences, or you’ll end up with what’s called a “comma splice.”

Finding Run-ons

Try these two tests:

  • Turn your sentence into a yes/no question.
  • Turn your sentence into a tag question (e.g., "...isn't it?").

If the sentence is not a run-on, this is easy. "My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus" becomes "Is my favorite Mediterranean spread hummus?"

But the run-on "My favorite Mediterranean spread is hummus it is very garlicky" cannot become one single question. You have to break it apart: "Is my favorite Mediterranean spread hummus? Is it very garlicky?" This shows it's a run-on.

Exercise I: Correcting Run-ons

Try to correct the following run-on sentences.

  1. My mother and father and sister are coming to dinner tonight.
  2. I like learning English it makes me tired.
  3. My sister was taller than me when we were young now I am the tallest it is fun.
  4. I love school, I love learning, my teacher is nice.
  5. I don’t want much for my birthday just some chocolates and a little toy car.
  1. My mother, father, and sister are coming to dinner tonight. (This was already a list, not a run-on)
  2. I like learning English, but it makes me tired.
  3. My sister was taller than me when we were young; now I am the tallest. It is fun.
  4. I love school and I love learning. My teacher is nice.
  5. I don’t want much for my birthday, just some chocolates and a little toy car.

chapters.title: Modifiers
chapters.content:
In English grammar, a modifier is a word, phrase, or clause that functions as an adjective or adverb to provide additional information about another word or word group (called the head). A modifier is also known as an adjunct.

He is a cute baby.

In this sentence, “cute” is an adjective modifying the noun, “baby.” The adjective “cute” is a modifier. “Cute” modifies the type of baby.

Dangling Modifier

A dangling modifier is a word or phrase that modifies a word not clearly stated in the sentence. A modifier describes, clarifies, or gives more detail about a concept.

Correct: Having finished the assignment, Jill turned on the TV.

"Having finished" states an action, and the doer of that action is logically the subject of the main clause, Jill. This sentence is correct.

Incorrect (Dangling): Having finished the assignment, the TV was turned on.

Here, the doer of the action "Having finished" is not the TV set. Since the doer is not clearly stated, the phrase is a dangling modifier.

Strategies for revising dangling modifiers:

  1. Name the appropriate doer of the action as the subject of the main clause:

    Incorrect: Having arrived late for practice, a written excuse was needed.
    Revised: Having arrived late for practice, the team captain needed a written excuse.

  2. Change the phrase that dangles into a complete introductory clause by naming the doer of the action in that clause:

    Incorrect: Without knowing his name, it was difficult to introduce him.
    Revised: Because Maria did not know his name, it was difficult to introduce him.

  3. Combine the phrase and main clause into one:

    Incorrect: To improve his results, the experiment was done again.
    Revised: He improved his results by doing the experiment again.

Misplaced Modifier

Modifiers are words, phrases, or clauses that add description to sentences. Typically, you will find a modifier snuggled right next to—either in front of or behind—the word it logically describes. When a modifier is placed too far away from the word it should describe, it is a misplaced modifier.

Incorrect: Raymond wore his one collared shirt to the job interview, which was unfortunately stained with yellow mustard.

The clause 'which was unfortunately stained with yellow mustard' is describing 'interview', but an interview can't get stained. It should describe the shirt.

Correct: Raymond wore his one collared shirt, which was unfortunately stained with yellow mustard, to the job interview.

Exercise II: Correct Misplaced Modifiers

The following sentences may contain misplaced modifiers. Rewrite them correctly. Some may be correct.

  1. The man was stopped for speeding in the blue sweater.
  2. I almost saw the whole movie, but I fell asleep around midnight.
  3. Joey promised to mow the lawn running out the door.
  4. The initials were those of the lovers carved on the tree.
  5. There are only two parking spaces left in the lot.
  6. Every four hours the doctor told him to take a pill.

Rewritten sentences will vary. Here are some possible corrections:

  1. The man in the blue sweater was stopped for speeding.
  2. I saw almost the whole movie, but I fell asleep around midnight.
  3. Running out the door, Joey promised to mow the lawn.
  4. The initials of the lovers were carved on the tree. (Correct)
  5. Only two parking spaces are left in the lot.
  6. The doctor told him to take a pill every four hours.

chapters.title: Parallelism
chapters.content:
Parallel structure means using the same pattern of words to show that two or more ideas have the same level of importance. This can happen at the word, phrase, or clause level. The usual way to join parallel structures is with the use of coordinating conjunctions such as "and" or "or."

Words and Phrases

When you have a series of items, ensure they are in the same grammatical form.

With the -ing form (gerund):

Parallel: Mary likes hiking, swimming, and bicycling.

With infinitive phrases:

Parallel: Mary likes to hike, to swim, and to ride a bicycle. OR Mary likes to hike, swim, and ride a bicycle.

Do not mix forms:

Not Parallel: Mary likes hiking, swimming, and to ride a bicycle.

Corrected: Mary likes hiking, swimming, and riding a bicycle.

Clauses

A parallel structure that begins with clauses must keep on with clauses. Changing to another pattern will break the parallelism.

Not Parallel: The coach told the players that they should get a lot of sleep, that they should not eat too much, and to do some warm-up exercises before the game.

Parallel: The coach told the players that they should get a lot of sleep, that they should not eat too much, and that they should do some warm-up exercises before the game.

Lists after a Colon

Be sure to keep all the elements in a list in the same form.

Not Parallel: The dictionary can be used to find these: word meanings, pronunciations, correct spellings, and looking up irregular verbs.

Parallel: The dictionary can be used to find these: word meanings, pronunciations, correct spellings, and irregular verbs.

Correlative Conjunctions

In the case of correlative conjunctions (not only...but also; both...and; neither...nor; either...or), the grammatical form of the first construction should be parallel in the second construction.

Not Parallel: She is either exaggerating or she is telling the truth.

Parallel: She is either exaggerating or telling the truth.

Exercise I: Correcting Faulty Parallelism

Correct the faulty parallelism in the following sentences to make them clear and concise.

  1. Linda gets her daily exercise by walking her dog, going for a bike ride, and cleaning.
  2. Would you prefer the graceful owl, rats, or a sneaky cat as your pet?
  3. The difference between rural and country living is the height of the buildings and the population.
  4. Stress makes it difficult to exercise regularly, have relationships that are stable, and be eating food with benefits to one’s health.
  5. The Writing Center can help your writing skills, to gain independence, and confidently completing your assignments.

Possible corrections:

  1. Linda gets her daily exercise by walking her dog, riding her bike, and cleaning her house.
  2. Would you prefer the graceful owl, the pesky rat, or the sneaky cat as your pet?
  3. The difference between rural and country living is the height of the buildings and the size of the population.
  4. Stress makes it difficult to exercise regularly, to have stable relationships, and to eat healthy food.
  5. The Writing Center can help you improve your writing skills, gain independence, and complete your assignments confidently.

chapters.title: Confusing Word Pairs
chapters.content:
Some words in English look or sound similar but have very different meanings. Using the wrong word can change the entire meaning of your sentence. This section will help you understand the differences between some of the most commonly confused word pairs.

1. Accept/Except

accept: A verb meaning “to agree to” or “to receive”

এক ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “সম্মত হওয়া” বা “গ্রহণ করা”

EXAMPLE: I accept your apology.
উদাহরণ: আমি তোমার ক্ষমা প্রার্থনা গ্রহণ করছি।

except: A preposition meaning “excluding”

একটি অব্যয় যার অর্থ “বাদ দিয়ে”

EXAMPLE: I like all vegetables except broccoli.
উদাহরণ: ব্রোকলি ছাড়া আমার সব সবজিই ভালো লাগে।

2. Affect/Effect

affect: A verb meaning “to influence”

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “প্রভাবিত করা”

EXAMPLE: Will missing class affect my grade?
উদাহরণ: ক্লাস বাদ দিলে কি আমার গ্রেডে প্রভাব পড়বে?

effect: A noun meaning “result” or a verb meaning “to cause”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “ফল” অথবা একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “ঘটনোর কারণ হওয়া”

EXAMPLE: The effect of missing class will be a lower grade. (noun) Only the supervisor could effect change to the rules. (verb)
উদাহরণ: ক্লাস বাদ দেওয়ার ফল হবে একটি কম গ্রেড। (বিশেষ্য) শুধুমাত্র সুপারভাইজারই নিয়ম পরিবর্তন ঘটাতে পারতেন। (ক্রিয়া)

3. Allusion/Illusion

allusion: A noun describing an indirect reference to something

একটি বিশেষ্য যা কোনো কিছুর পরোক্ষ উল্লেখ বোঝায়

EXAMPLE: The speaker made an allusion to a Greek myth.
উদাহরণ: বক্তা একটি গ্রীক পুরাণের পরোক্ষ উল্লেখ করেছিলেন।

illusion: A noun indicating something that misleads or gives a false meaning or appearance

একটি বিশেষ্য যা বিভ্রান্ত করে বা ভুল অর্থ বা চেহারা দেয় এমন কিছু নির্দেশ করে

EXAMPLE: A magician uses illusion to entertain the audience.
উদাহরণ: একজন যাদুকর দর্শকদের বিনোদন দিতে মায়া ব্যবহার করে।

4. Cite/Site/Sight

cite: A verb meaning “to quote an example or authority”

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “একটি উদাহরণ বা কর্তৃপক্ষকে উদ্ধৃত করা”

EXAMPLE: You must cite all of your sources in your research paper.
উদাহরণ: আপনার গবেষণা পত্রে অবশ্যই আপনার সমস্ত উৎস উল্লেখ করতে হবে।

site: A noun meaning “a particular place”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “একটি নির্দিষ্ট স্থান”

EXAMPLE: We visited several tourist sites.
উদাহরণ: আমরা বেশ কয়েকটি পর্যটন স্থান পরিদর্শন করেছি।

sight: A noun describing the function of “seeing”

একটি বিশেষ্য যা “দেখা” এর কাজ বর্ণনা করে

EXAMPLE: Human beings have five senses: sight, touch, taste, sound, and smell.
উদাহরণ: মানুষের পাঁচটি ইন্দ্রিয় আছে: দৃষ্টি, স্পর্শ, স্বাদ, শব্দ এবং গন্ধ।

5. Compliment/Complement

compliment: A noun that means “an expression of flattery, praise, or admiration”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “প্রশংসা, স্তুতি বা তারিফের অভিব্যক্তি”

EXAMPLE: Her compliment of my new dress made me smile.
উদাহরণ: আমার নতুন পোশাকের প্রশংসা শুনে আমি হাসলাম।

complement: A noun that means “to complete” or “to add to” something

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “সম্পূর্ণ করা” বা “কোনো কিছুতে যোগ করা”

EXAMPLE: Butter is the perfect complement for bread.
উদাহরণ: মাখন রুটির জন্য নিখুঁত পরিপূরক।

6. Council/Counsel

council: A noun meaning “a group of people who meet together to make decisions”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “সিদ্ধান্ত নেওয়ার জন্য একত্রিত হওয়া একদল লোক”

EXAMPLE: Kamri was elected president of the school’s student council.
উদাহরণ: কামরি স্কুলের ছাত্র পরিষদের সভাপতি নির্বাচিত হয়েছিলেন।

counsel: A noun meaning “advice” or a verb meaning “to advise”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “পরামর্শ” অথবা একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “পরামর্শ দেওয়া”

EXAMPLE: My mom gave me good counsel about living on my own. (noun) She counseled me to not procrastinate my homework. (verb)
উদাহরণ: আমার মা আমাকে নিজের মতো করে জীবনযাপন সম্পর্কে ভালো পরামর্শ দিয়েছিলেন। (বিশেষ্য) তিনি আমাকে বাড়ির কাজ ফেলে না রাখতে পরামর্শ দিয়েছিলেন। (ক্রিয়া)

7. Explicit/Implicit

explicit: An adjective meaning “direct”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “প্রত্যক্ষ” বা “সুস্পষ্ট”

EXAMPLE: Professor Anderson gave explicit instructions for writing the paper.
উদাহরণ: অধ্যাপক অ্যান্ডারসন কাগজ লেখার জন্য সুস্পষ্ট নির্দেশাবলী দিয়েছিলেন।

implicit: An adjective meaning “implied”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “উহ্য” বা “পরোক্ষ”

EXAMPLE: Her description of the party contained an implicit insult of the host.
উদাহরণ: পার্টির তার বর্ণনায় হোস্টের প্রতি একটি উহ্য অপমান ছিল।

8. Farther/Further

farther: An adjective that describes an actual distance

একটি বিশেষণ যা একটি প্রকৃত দূরত্ব বর্ণনা করে

EXAMPLE: My house is farther from campus than yours.
উদাহরণ: আমার বাড়ি ক্যাম্পাসের চেয়ে তোমার বাড়ির থেকে আরও দূরে।

further: An adjective meaning “more distant in degree, time, space, or quantity”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “মাত্রা, সময়, স্থান বা পরিমাণে আরও দূরবর্তী”

EXAMPLE: Nothing could be further from the truth.
উদাহরণ: সত্য থেকে এর থেকে আর বেশি কিছু দূর হতে পারে না।

9. Fewer/Less

fewer: An adjective meaning “a small number” that refers to things that can be counted

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “একটি ছোট সংখ্যা” যা গণনা করা যায় এমন জিনিস বোঝায়

EXAMPLE: Children have fewer teeth than adults.
উদাহরণ: শিশুদের প্রাপ্তবয়স্কদের চেয়ে কম দাঁত থাকে।

less: An adjective meaning “little” that refers to a general amount or non-countable measurement

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “কম” যা একটি সাধারণ পরিমাণ বা অগণনাযোগ্য পরিমাপ বোঝায়

EXAMPLE: I prefer less salt on my popcorn.
উদাহরণ: আমি আমার পপকর্নে কম লবণ পছন্দ করি।

10. Good/Well

good: An adjective meaning “suitable”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “উপযুক্ত” বা “ভালো”

EXAMPLE: It was a good movie.
উদাহরণ: এটি একটি ভালো সিনেমা ছিল।

well: An adverb meaning “in a proper manner”

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “সঠিকভাবে” বা “ভালোভাবে”

EXAMPLE: She plays basketball well.
উদাহরণ: সে ভালো বাস্কেটবল খেলে।

11. Imply/Infer

imply: A verb meaning “to suggest or state indirectly” (refers to the speaker)

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “পরোক্ষভাবে ইঙ্গিত করা বা বলা” (বক্তাকে বোঝায়)

EXAMPLE: He implied that I wasn’t capable of completing the job.
উদাহরণ: সে ইঙ্গিত করেছিল যে আমি কাজটি শেষ করতে সক্ষম নই।

infer: A verb meaning “to conclude” (refers to the listener)

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “উপসংহারে পৌঁছানো” (শ্রোতাকে বোঝায়)

EXAMPLE: I inferred there was trouble from the sight of the police cars.
উদাহরণ: পুলিশের গাড়ি দেখে আমি অনুমান করেছিলাম যে কোনো সমস্যা হয়েছে।

12. Its/It’s

its: A personal possessive pronoun of “it”

“it” এর ব্যক্তিগত সম্বন্ধসূচক সর্বনাম

EXAMPLE: The bird broke its wing.
উদাহরণ: পাখিটি তার ডানা ভেঙেছিল।

it’s: A contraction meaning “it is” or “it has”

একটি সংক্ষিপ্ত রূপ যার অর্থ “it is” বা “it has”

EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, it’s time to leave.
উদাহরণ: দুর্ভাগ্যবশত, এখন যাওয়ার সময়।

13. Lay/Lie

lay: A verb that means “to put or place” and that needs a direct object

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “স্থাপন করা” এবং একটি প্রত্যক্ষ কর্মের প্রয়োজন হয়

EXAMPLE: Lay the book on the table.
উদাহরণ: বইটি টেবিলের উপর রাখো।

lie: A verb that means “to rest or recline” and that takes no direct object

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “বিশ্রাম করা” বা “হেলান দেওয়া” এবং এর কোনো প্রত্যক্ষ কর্মের প্রয়োজন হয় না

EXAMPLE: I’m going to lie down for a while.
উদাহরণ: আমি কিছুক্ষণ শুয়ে থাকব।

14. Loose/Lose

loose: An adjective meaning “not tight”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “আঁটসাঁট নয়” বা “ঢিলেঢালা”

EXAMPLE: I like to wear loose clothing.
উদাহরণ: আমি ঢিলেঢালা পোশাক পরতে পছন্দ করি।

lose: A verb that means “to misplace” or “to be defeated”

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “হারিয়ে ফেলা” বা “পরাজিত হওয়া”

EXAMPLE: I hate it when I lose my keys.
উদাহরণ: আমি যখন আমার চাবি হারাই তখন আমার খুব খারাপ লাগে।

15. May be/Maybe

may be: A verb phrase meaning “it might be possible”

একটি ক্রিয়াপদ যার অর্থ “এটি সম্ভব হতে পারে”

EXAMPLE: The storm may be more hazardous than we thought.
উদাহরণ: ঝড়টি আমাদের ধারণার চেয়েও বেশি বিপজ্জনক হতে পারে।

maybe: An adverb showing possibility

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যা সম্ভাবনা দেখায়

EXAMPLE: Maybe you should go to the doctor.
উদাহরণ: সম্ভবত তোমার ডাক্তারের কাছে যাওয়া উচিত।

16. Principal/Principle

principal: A noun meaning “the head of a school” or an adjective meaning “most important”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “একটি স্কুলের প্রধান” অথবা একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “সবচেয়ে গুরুত্বপূর্ণ”

EXAMPLE: Mrs. Smith, the principal of the school, is a very energetic woman. (noun)
উদাহরণ: মিসেস স্মিথ, স্কুলের অধ্যক্ষ, একজন অত্যন্ত উদ্যমী মহিলা। (বিশেষ্য)

principle: A noun meaning “a basic truth”

একটি বিশেষ্য যার অর্থ “একটি মৌলিক সত্য” বা “নীতি”

EXAMPLE: Lying is against my principles.
উদাহরণ: মিথ্যা বলা আমার নীতির বিরুদ্ধে।

17. Quite/Quiet/Quit

quite: An adverb meaning “whole” or “complete”

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “সম্পূর্ণ” বা “একেবারে”

EXAMPLE: He is quite thorough in his calculations.
উদাহরণ: তার গণনায় সে বেশ পুঙ্খানুপুঙ্খ।

quiet: An adjective meaning “not making noise”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “শব্দ না করা” বা “শান্ত”

EXAMPLE: Please be quiet; the baby is sleeping.
উদাহরণ: অনুগ্রহ করে শান্ত হন; শিশুটি ঘুমাচ্ছে।

quit: A verb meaning “to stop” or “give up”

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “থামা” বা “ছেড়ে দেওয়া”

EXAMPLE: I quit my job last Thursday.
উদাহরণ: আমি গত বৃহস্পতিবার আমার চাকরি ছেড়ে দিয়েছি।

18. Set/Sit

set: A verb meaning “to place” and requiring a direct object

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “স্থাপন করা” এবং একটি প্রত্যক্ষ কর্মের প্রয়োজন হয়

EXAMPLE: Ashley set her books on the table.
উদাহরণ: অ্যাশলি তার বইগুলো টেবিলের উপর রাখল।

sit: A verb meaning “to be seated” and that takes no direct object

একটি ক্রিয়া যার অর্থ “বসা” এবং এর কোনো প্রত্যক্ষ কর্মের প্রয়োজন হয় না

EXAMPLE: Come sit by me.
উদাহরণ: এসে আমার পাশে বসো।

19. Than/Then

than: A conjunction introducing a second element in a comparison

একটি সংযোজক অব্যয় যা একটি তুলনার দ্বিতীয় উপাদান প্রবর্তন করে

EXAMPLE: I am taller than my sister.
উদাহরণ: আমি আমার বোনের চেয়ে লম্বা।

then: An adverb meaning “at that time,” “next,” or “after”

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “তখন,” “তারপর,” বা “পরে”

EXAMPLE: He picked up the tickets, and then he picked up his date.
উদাহরণ: সে টিকিটগুলো তুলল, তারপর তার ডেটকে নিয়ে গেল।

20. There/Their/They’re

there: An adverb meaning “in that place”

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “সেই স্থানে” বা “সেখানে”

EXAMPLE: Put the books down there.
উদাহরণ: বইগুলো সেখানে রাখো।

their: A personal possessive pronoun for “they”

“they” এর ব্যক্তিগত সম্বন্ধসূচক সর্বনাম

EXAMPLE: It’s their fault!
উদাহরণ: এটা তাদেরই দোষ!

they’re: A contraction for “they are”

“they are” এর সংক্ষিপ্ত রূপ

EXAMPLE: They’re going to eat dinner at seven.
উদাহরণ: তারা সাতটায় রাতের খাবার খেতে যাচ্ছে।

21. Thorough/Through/Threw

thorough: An adjective meaning “complete in all respects”

একটি বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “সকল দিক থেকে সম্পূর্ণ” বা “পুঙ্খানুপুঙ্খ”

EXAMPLE: Steve did a thorough job washing my car.
উদাহরণ: স্টিভ আমার গাড়ি ধোয়ার কাজটি পুঙ্খানুপুঙ্খভাবে করেছে।

through: A preposition meaning “in one side and out another side”

একটি অব্যয় যার অর্থ “একপাশ দিয়ে ঢুকে অন্য পাশ দিয়ে বেরিয়ে যাওয়া” বা “ভিতর দিয়ে”

EXAMPLE: To get to my apartment, you must drive through the tunnel.
উদাহরণ: আমার অ্যাপার্টমেন্টে যেতে হলে তোমাকে টানেলের ভিতর দিয়ে যেতে হবে।

threw: The irregular past tense form of the verb “throw”

“throw” ক্রিয়ার অনিয়মিত অতীতকাল রূপ

EXAMPLE: Chris threw the ball at me.
উদাহরণ: ক্রিস আমার দিকে বল ছুড়েছিল।

22. To/Too/Two

to: Either a preposition or the initial part of an infinitive verb phrase

হয় একটি অব্যয় অথবা একটি অসীম ক্রিয়া পদের প্রাথমিক অংশ

EXAMPLE: My mom sent me to the store. (preposition)
উদাহরণ: আমার মা আমাকে দোকানে পাঠিয়েছিলেন। (অব্যয়)

too: An adverb meaning “also”

একটি ক্রিয়া বিশেষণ যার অর্থ “এছাড়াও” বা “খুব বেশি”

EXAMPLE: I like dancing, and I like singing, too.
উদাহরণ: আমি নাচ পছন্দ করি, এবং গান গাওয়াও পছন্দ করি।

two: The number 2

সংখ্যা ২

EXAMPLE: I have two dogs.
উদাহরণ: আমার দুটি কুকুর আছে।

23. Weather/Whether

weather: A noun referring to the condition of the atmosphere

একটি বিশেষ্য যা বায়ুমণ্ডলের অবস্থা বোঝায়

EXAMPLE: We are having unusual weather for this time of year.
উদাহরণ: বছরের এই সময়ে আমাদের অস্বাভাবিক আবহাওয়া চলছে।

whether: A conjunction that indicates a choice between things

একটি সংযোজক অব্যয় যা জিনিসগুলির মধ্যে একটি পছন্দ নির্দেশ করে

EXAMPLE: Sarah couldn’t decide whether she should go to the dance or stay home.
উদাহরণ: সারাহ সিদ্ধান্ত নিতে পারছিল না যে সে নাচে যাবে নাকি বাড়িতে থাকবে।

24. Whose/Who’s

whose: A personal possessive pronoun for “who”

“who” এর ব্যক্তিগত সম্বন্ধসূচক সর্বনাম

EXAMPLE: Whose book is that anyway?
উদাহরণ: এই বইটি কার?

who’s: A contraction for “who is” or “who has”

“who is” বা “who has” এর সংক্ষিপ্ত রূপ

EXAMPLE: Who’s here?
উদাহরণ: এখানে কে আছে?

25. Your/You’re

your: A personal possessive pronoun for “you”

“you” এর ব্যক্তিগত সম্বন্ধসূচক সর্বনাম

EXAMPLE: Is that your new car?
উদাহরণ: ওটা কি তোমার নতুন গাড়ি?

you’re: A contraction for “you are”

“you are” এর সংক্ষিপ্ত রূপ

EXAMPLE: You’re a good friend.
উদাহরণ: তুমি একজন ভালো বন্ধু।

chapters.title: Phrasal Verbs
chapters.content:
A phrasal verb is a verb that is made up of a main verb together with an adverb or a preposition, or both. Typically, their meaning is not obvious from the meanings of the individual words themselves. You should know that sb. stands for "somebody" and sth. stands for "something".

1. Pick up

Meaning: answer a telephone call.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ফোন ধরা।

Example: I kept calling her but she wouldn't pick up, so I couldn't tell her the news.

2. Speak up

Meaning: talk more loudly.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: জোরে কথা বলা।

Example: (On the phone) Could you speak up, please? I can't hear you properly.

3. Hang up (on sb.)

Meaning: end a telephone call.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ফোন রেখে দেওয়া (কারো উপর)।

Example: She hung up on me when I told her what I'd done.

4. Chill out

Meaning: calm down and relax.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: শান্ত হওয়া এবং আরাম করা।

Example: At the end of the day, I just want to put my feet up and chill out before going to bed.

5. Doze off

Meaning: fall lightly asleep.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: হালকাভাবে ঘুমিয়ে পড়া।

Example: I don't take a real nap after lunch, I simply doze off for a bit in front of the TV.

6. Run out of (sth.)

Meaning: finish one’s supply of something.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো কিছুর সরবরাহ শেষ হয়ে যাওয়া।

Example: We've run out of eggs; could you go and get some more, please?

7. Put sth. back

Meaning: replace something.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু জিনিস আগের জায়গায় ফিরিয়ে রাখা।

Example: Remember to put the books back on the shelves when you finish reading them.

8. Look after sb./sth.

Meaning: take care of something or someone.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কারো বা কিছুর যত্ন নেওয়া।

Example: I normally ask my parents to look after my dog when I'm on holiday abroad.

9. Talk back to sb.

Meaning: reply defiantly or insolently.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কারো সাথে অবাধ্যভাবে বা অভদ্রভাবে উত্তর দেওয়া।

Example: Unfortunately, all children talk back to their parents from time to time.

10. Go for sth.

Meaning: decide on something; choose.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো কিছু সিদ্ধান্ত নেওয়া; নির্বাচন করা।

Example: (In a restaurant) I think I'll go for the steak this time. I didn't like the fish the other day.

11. Break up (with sb.)

Meaning: end a romantic relationship with someone.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কারো সাথে প্রেমের সম্পর্ক ভেঙে ফেলা।

Example: After they broke up, he didn't leave his house for a week.

12. Break (sth.) down

Meaning: stop or cause to stop functioning.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো কিছু ভেঙে যাওয়া বা কার্যকারিতা বন্ধ করা।

Example: My TV seems to be breaking down all the time.

13. Hang (sth.) out (to dry)

Meaning: hang from a clothes line to dry.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (কাপড়) শুকানোর জন্য দড়িতে ঝোলানো।

Example: I don't mind ironing, but I hate hanging the clothes out to dry.

14. Wash (sth.) up

Meaning: clean crockery and cutlery after use.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ব্যবহার করার পর থালা-বাসন ধোয়া।

Example: I don't have to wash up any more; I bought myself a dishwasher.

15. Warm sth. up

Meaning: reheat previously cooked food or drink.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো কিছু (খাবার বা পানীয়) পুনরায় গরম করা।

Example: I sometimes have to warm up my coffee because it takes me a whole morning to drink it.

16. Heat sth. up

Meaning: make or become hot or warm.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো কিছু গরম করা বা গরম হওয়া।

Example: I think we can heat up yesterday's pizza and have it for dinner, right?

17. Look for sth./sb.

Meaning: try to find something or someone.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু বা কাউকে খোঁজা।

Example: Jack was looking for his phone everywhere, but couldn't find it.

18. Fall out with sb.

Meaning: have an argument and stop being friends.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কারো সাথে ঝগড়া করা এবং বন্ধুত্ব বন্ধ করা।

Example: They were flat mates for two years, but then they fell out and never spoke to each other again.

19. Come down with (an illness)

Meaning: begin to suffer from a specified illness.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কোনো নির্দিষ্ট অসুস্থতায় আক্রান্ত হওয়া শুরু করা।

Example: Oh, god! I think I'm coming down with flu. I might not go to work tomorrow.

20. Tear sth. out

Meaning: to pull or be pulled apart, or to pull pieces off.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু ছিঁড়ে ফেলা বা আলাদা করে ফেলা।

Example: He tore out the pages that he didn't want anyone to read.

21. Rip sth. up

Meaning: tear something violently into small pieces so as to destroy it.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু ছিঁড়ে টুকরো টুকরো করে নষ্ট করে ফেলা।

Example: She ripped up her pile of old letters and put them in the bin.

22. Plug sth. in

Meaning: connect an electrical appliance to the mains by inserting a plug in a socket.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (বৈদ্যুতিক যন্ত্র) সকেটে লাগিয়ে চালু করা।

Example: I need to plug in my phone; it's completely out of juice.

23. Pay sb./sth. back

Meaning: repay some money or a loan to someone.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কাউকে টাকা বা ঋণ ফেরত দেওয়া।

Example: If you lend me the money, I swear I'll pay you back by Friday.

24. Print sth. out

Meaning: produce a paper copy of information stored on a computer.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কম্পিউটার থেকে কোনো তথ্যের কাগজের কপি তৈরি করা।

Example: My boss asked me to print out the report and give it to him.

25. Give in (to sb./sth.)

Meaning: accept someone’s wish or cease fighting; admit defeat.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কারো ইচ্ছা মেনে নেওয়া বা লড়াই বন্ধ করা; পরাজয় স্বীকার করা।

Example: He reluctantly gave in to the pressure they were putting on him.

26. Work sth. out

Meaning: find or try to find the answer to something; solve a sum or determine an amount by calculation.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (সমস্যা বা হিসাব) সমাধান করা।

Example: I couldn’t work out whether it was a band playing or a record.

27. Give up

Meaning: stop making an effort; admit defeat.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: চেষ্টা করা বন্ধ করা; পরাজয় স্বীকার করা।

Example: It's not like you to give up so easily on an assignment so early after starting school.

28. Put up with sth./sb.

Meaning: tolerate, endure, bear.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু বা কারো সাথে সহ্য করা, মেনে নেওয়া।

Example: I'm leaving so I don't have to put up with you anymore.

29. Turn sth. on

Meaning: adjust a tap or switch in order to start the operation or flow of something.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (পানি, আলো, বিদ্যুৎ) চালু করা।

Example: She turned her PC on and opened her browser.

30. Log in

Meaning: go through the procedures to begin use of a computer, database, or system.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কম্পিউটার, ডেটাবেস বা সিস্টেমে প্রবেশ করা।

Example: I tried to log in with my username, but I couldn't remember my password.

31. Go off

Meaning: (of an alarm) begin to sound.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: (অ্যালার্ম) বেজে ওঠা।

Example: From the time my alarm clock goes off, I am beginning my workout.

32. Wake (sb.) up

Meaning: emerge or cause someone to emerge from sleep.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ঘুম থেকে জেগে ওঠা বা কাউকে জাগানো।

Example: I woke up at 7 o'clock.

33. Get (sb.) up

Meaning: rise or cause someone to rise from bed after sleeping.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ঘুম থেকে ওঠা বা কাউকে বিছানা থেকে তোলা।

Example: I got up feeling tired and disoriented.

34. Put sth. on

Meaning: place a garment, jewellery, etc. on part of one’s body

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (পোশাক, গয়না) পরা।

Example: I put on my watch and set off a little late.

35. Dress up

Meaning: put on smart or formal clothes.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সুন্দর বা আনুষ্ঠানিক পোশাক পরা।

Example: I only dress up on special occasions, like weddings or other celebrations.

36. Tidy up (sth.)

Meaning: bring order to; arrange neatly.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (জায়গা) পরিপাটি করা।

Example: The children don't like tidying up their bedrooms, but they always do it.

37. Switch sth. on

Meaning: start the flow or operation of something by means of a tap, switch, or button.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (আলো, টিভি, যন্ত্র) চালু করা।

Example: She switched on the TV to watch her favourite show.

38. Take sth. off

Meaning: remove clothing from one’s or another’s body.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কিছু (পোশাক) খুলে ফেলা।

Example: I took off my shoes and lay down on the sofa.

39. Warm up

Meaning: prepare for physical exertion or a performance by exercising or practicing gently beforehand.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: (শারীরিক পরিশ্রম বা পরিবেশনার জন্য) হালকা ব্যায়াম করে প্রস্তুত হওয়া।

Example: I always warm up thoroughly before going out for a jog.

40. Work out

Meaning: engage in vigorous physical exercise.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: (শারীরিক) ব্যায়াম করা।

Example: John tries to work out three or four times a week at the local gym.

41. Let sb. in

Meaning: admit someone to a room, building, or area.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কাউকে (ঘরে, বাড়িতে) প্রবেশ করতে দেওয়া।

Example: We let our lovely dog in the house every morning.

42. Come in

Meaning: enter a room, building, or other place.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: (ঘরে, বাড়িতে) প্রবেশ করা।

Example: Please, come in and sit down.

43. Move over

Meaning: adjust one’s position to make room for someone else.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অন্য কারো জন্য জায়গা করে দিতে নিজের অবস্থান পরিবর্তন করা।

Example: Could you guys move over so I can sit down as well, please?

44. Kick sb. out

Meaning: expel or dismiss someone.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কাউকে তাড়িয়ে দেওয়া বা বরখাস্ত করা।

Example: They kicked me out of the club after the fight.

45. Drink up

Meaning: quickly consume the rest of a drink.

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: পানীয় দ্রুত পান করে শেষ করা।

Example: She drank up what was left of her beer and left in a hurry.

chapters.title: Academic Word List 2
chapters.content:
This is the second list of important words frequently used in academic texts. Mastering these will further enhance your reading comprehension and writing skills.

1. incongruity

English Definition: the quality of disagreeing; being unsuitable and inappropriate

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অসঙ্গতি; বেমানান বা অনুপযুক্ত হওয়া।

Examples:

  • The incongruity between the decisions of the parents can ruin a child’s life.
  • There is a huge sense of incongruity between what he says and what he does.

2. inconsequential

English Definition: lacking worth or importance

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: মূল্যহীন বা গুরুত্বহীন; অকিঞ্চিৎকর।

Examples:

  • Worrying about inconsequential tasks will prevent you from doing projects which really matter.
  • Despite the teacher’s warning, the students would not stop their inconsequential chatter.

3. incorporate

English Definition: make into a whole or make part of a whole

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অন্তর্ভুক্ত করা; একটি সম্পূর্ণ অংশ তৈরি করা।

Examples:

  • No definition is complete without incorporating examples.
  • We can incorporate this information into our report.

4. indeterminate

English Definition: not fixed or known in advance

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অনির্ধারিত; আগে থেকে স্থির বা জানা নয়।

Examples:

  • We are expecting an indeterminate number of guests.
  • The judge sentenced the drunk driver to an indeterminate prison stretch of seven to fifteen years.

5. indigence

English Definition: a state of extreme poverty or destitution

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: চরম দারিদ্র্য বা অভাবের অবস্থা; দীনতা।

Examples:

  • Their indigence appalled him.
  • The luxury of one class is counterbalanced by the indigence of another.

6. indolent

English Definition: disinclined to work or exertion

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অলস; কাজ বা শ্রমে অনাগ্রহী।

Examples:

  • The natives were allowed to live the indolent life of the tropics.
  • Rather than fetch the ball, the indolent dog decided to take a nap.

7. inert

English Definition: unable to move or resist motion

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নিস্তেজ; নড়াচড়া করতে বা গতির প্রতিরোধ করতে অক্ষম।

Examples:

  • After being sprayed with the poison, the fly was inert and could not move.
  • He lay, inert, in his bed.

8. ingenuous

English Definition: lacking in sophistication or worldliness

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সরল; পরিশীলিত বা জাগতিক জ্ঞানের অভাব।

Examples:

  • He seemed too ingenuous for a reporter.
  • It is ingenuous to suppose that money did not play a part in his decision.

9. inherent

English Definition: existing as an essential constituent or characteristic

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অন্তর্নিহিত; অপরিহার্য উপাদান বা বৈশিষ্ট্য হিসাবে বিদ্যমান।

Examples:

  • Most mothers have an inherent need to protect their children.
  • There was an inherent weakness in the design.

10. innocuous

English Definition: not injurious to physical or mental health

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: ক্ষতিকর নয়; শারীরিক বা মানসিক স্বাস্থ্যের জন্য আঘাতজনক নয়।

Examples:

  • While you may think bullying is innocuous, it leaves a lasting scar on its victim.
  • His comment seemed perfectly innocuous.

11. insensible

English Definition: barely able to be perceived

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অনূভবাতীত; প্রায় উপলব্ধি করা যায় না এমন।

Examples:

  • We are not insensible of your kindness.
  • She remained insensible of the dangers that lay ahead.

12. insinuate

English Definition: suggest in an indirect or covert way; give to understand

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: পরোক্ষভাবে ইঙ্গিত করা; সূক্ষ্মভাবে বোঝানো।

Examples:

  • Many dictators use propaganda to insinuate fear among the public.
  • He tried to insinuate himself into the boss's favor.

13. insipid

English Definition: lacking interest or significance or impact

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নীরস; আগ্রহ, তাৎপর্য বা প্রভাবের অভাব।

Examples:

  • After an hour of insipid conversation, I left.
  • On the surface she seemed meek, rather insipid.

14. insularity

English Definition: the state of being isolated or detached

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: বিচ্ছিন্নতা; বিচ্ছিন্ন বা সংযুক্ত না থাকার অবস্থা।

Examples:

  • Part of this is explained by the neighborhood's insularity.
  • The way they lived then was remarkable for its innocence and its insularity.

15. intractable

English Definition: difficult to manage or mold

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: দুশ্চিকিৎস্য; পরিচালনা বা আকার দেওয়া কঠিন।

Examples:

  • Additional police officers were called to the scene when the crowd became intractable.
  • We are facing an intractable problem.

16. inundate

English Definition: overwhelm someone with things or people to deal with, or fill or cover with water

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: প্লাবিত করা; কোন কিছু বা মানুষের সাথে মোকাবিলা করতে overwhelmed হওয়া, অথবা জল দিয়ে ভরাট বা আচ্ছাদিত করা।

Examples:

  • We have been inundated with requests for help.
  • The fields were inundated with flood.

17. inured

English Definition: made tough by habitual exposure

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অভ্যস্ত; নিয়মিত সংস্পর্শে কঠিন করে তোলা।

Examples:

  • After living here for years I've become inured to the cold climate.
  • Doctors become inured to death.

18. invective

English Definition: abusive language used to express blame or censure

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কুৎসা; দোষ বা নিন্দা প্রকাশের জন্য ব্যবহৃত অপমানজনক ভাষা।

Examples:

  • He retorted the invective on her.
  • A woman had hurled racist invective at the family.

19. irresolute

English Definition: uncertain how to act or proceed

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অনির্দিষ্ট; কীভাবে কাজ করতে হবে বা অগ্রসর হতে হবে তা নিয়ে অনিশ্চিত।

Examples:

  • The irresolute spend the most precious moments of life regretting.
  • He is never irresolute or inactive.

20. laconic

English Definition: brief and to the point

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সংক্ষিপ্ত; অল্প কথায় এবং সরাসরি।

Examples:

  • She had a laconic explanation of the matter.
  • The manner is laconic yet earnest.

21. lassitude

English Definition: a feeling of lack of interest or energy

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অবসাদ; আগ্রহ বা শক্তির অভাব বোধ।

Examples:

  • I was overcome by lassitude.
  • Neither illness nor lassitude prevented him from going on with his work.

22. laud

English Definition: praise, glorify, or honor

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: প্রশংসা করা; মহিমান্বিত করা বা সম্মান জানানো।

Examples:

  • He was lauded for his courage.
  • They lauded the former president as a hero.

23. lethargic

English Definition: deficient in alertness or activity

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নিস্তেজ; সজাগতা বা কার্যকলাপের অভাব।

Examples:

  • The weather made her listless and lethargic.
  • He felt too miserable and lethargic to get dressed.

24. levee

English Definition: an embankment built to prevent a river from overflowing

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: বাঁধ; নদী উপচে পড়া রোধ করার জন্য নির্মিত একটি বাঁধ।

Examples:

  • Risks in levee engineering caused by many uncertainty factors are cared about by people.
  • Look at that long levee of logs.

25. levity

English Definition: a manner lacking seriousness

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: লঘুতা; গুরুগম্ভীরতার অভাব।

Examples:

  • Your levity is unseemly at this time.
  • His remarks injected a note of levity into the proceedings.

26. log

English Definition: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: কাঠের গুঁড়ি; ডালপালা ছাড়ানো গাছের কাণ্ডের একটি অংশ।

Examples:

  • He balanced himself on a log.
  • Tom put another log on the fire.

27. loquacious

English Definition: full of trivial conversation

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: বাচাল; তুচ্ছ কথায় পূর্ণ।

Examples:

  • His loquacious humour infected every one.
  • Fishes in a public aquarium grow loquacious, oblivious of their lack of privacy.

28. lucid

English Definition: transparently clear; easily understandable

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: সুস্পষ্ট; স্বচ্ছভাবে পরিষ্কার; সহজে বোধগম্য।

Examples:

  • She gave a clear and lucid account of her plans for the company's future.
  • You must write in a clear and lucid style.

29. malleable

English Definition: capable of being shaped or bent

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নমনীয়; আকার দেওয়া বা বাঁকানো যায় এমন।

Examples:

  • Knowledge gives you power by making you less malleable to negative influences.
  • Unfortunately, most teenagers are malleable and give in to peer pressure rather easily.

30. maverick

English Definition: someone who exhibits independence in thought and action

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: স্বতন্ত্রচেতা; চিন্তা ও কর্মে স্বাধীনতা প্রদর্শনকারী কেউ।

Examples:

  • My maverick boss has made his fortune by using a selling strategy different from that of his competitors.
  • He was too much of a maverick ever to hold high office.

31. mendacious

English Definition: given to lying

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: মিথ্যাবাদী; মিথ্যা বলার প্রবণতা।

Examples:

  • She gave us a mendacious report.
  • Some of these statements are misleading and some downright mendacious.

32. metamorphosis

English Definition: striking change in appearance or character or circumstances

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: রূপান্তর; চেহারা, চরিত্র বা পরিস্থিতির নাটকীয় পরিবর্তন।

Examples:

  • She had undergone an amazing metamorphosis from awkward schoolgirl to beautiful woman.
  • The metamorphosis was something to behold.

33. meticulous

English Definition: marked by precise accordance with details

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: খুঁতখুঁতে; পুঙ্খানুপুঙ্খ বিবরণের সাথে সুনির্দিষ্টভাবে চিহ্নিত।

Examples:

  • This accounting job requires a meticulous person.
  • The trip involved meticulous planning.

34. misanthrope

English Definition: someone who dislikes people in general

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: মানববিদ্বেষী; যিনি সাধারণভাবে মানুষকে অপছন্দ করেন।

Examples:

  • After I was kidnapped and held hostage for a week, I became a misanthrope and distrusted everyone.
  • Living in a crime-filled city will turn anyone into a nervous misanthrope.

35. mitigate

English Definition: lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: প্রশমিত করা; গুরত্ব বা পরিমাণ কমানো বা কমানোর চেষ্টা করা।

Examples:

  • It is unclear how to mitigate the effects of tourism on the island.
  • Governments should endeavour to mitigate distress.

36. mundane

English Definition: found in the ordinary course of events

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: জাগতিক; সাধারণ ঘটনাবলীর মধ্যে পাওয়া যায়।

Examples:

  • It was hard to return to mundane matters after such excitement.
  • Initially, the work was pretty mundane.

37. negate

English Definition: make ineffective by counterbalancing the effect of

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নাকচ করা; প্রতিভার দ্বারা এর প্রভাবকে অকার্যকর করে তোলা।

Examples:

  • They overlook the human ability to negate, which lies at the root of thinking.
  • These facts negate your theory.

38. neophyte

English Definition: any new participant in some activity

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: নবীন; কোনো কার্যকলাপে নতুন অংশগ্রহণকারী।

Examples:

  • Even the best golfer in the world was once a neophyte at the sport of golf.
  • The neophyte began to stammer out a reply, but fell silent.

39. officious

English Definition: intrusive in a meddling or offensive manner

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: অনধিকারচর্চাকারী; অনধিকার চর্চা বা আপত্তিকর ভাবে অনুপ্রবেশকারী।

Examples:

  • We were tired of being pushed around by officious civil servants.
  • He's an officious little man and widely disliked in the company.

40. paragon

English Definition: a perfect embodiment of a concept

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: আদর্শ; কোনো ধারণার নিখুঁত মূর্ত প্রতীক।

Examples:

  • As a paragon of purity, a nun would never dress inappropriately.
  • It would have taken a paragon of virtue not to feel jealous.

41. partisan

English Definition: prejudiced or in favour of a particular person, cause or thing

বাংলা ব্যাখ্যা: পক্ষপাতি; কোনো নির্দিষ্ট ব্যক্তি, কারণ বা জিনিসের প্রতি পক্ষপাতদুষ্ট বা অনুকূলে।

Examples:

  • The audience was very partisan, and refused to listen to the points she was making in her speech.
  • He is clearly too partisan to be a referee.
